name: WP Installer
author: Wordpress Installer

sections.description:
WP Installer is intended for new WP installations.
Instead of browsing each section to configure your new blog, you can easily do it through simple steps:

1- Manage Default Posts/Pages

  • Delete “Hello Worlds!” post

  • Delete “Hello Worlds!” comment

  • Delete “Sample Page!” page

  • Delete all posts

  • Delete all pages

  • Delete all comments

  • Delete all categories & tags

  • Delete all medias

2- Manage Default Widgets

  • Delete Recent Posts widget

  • Delete Recent Comments widget

  • Delete Archives widget

  • Delete Categories widget

  • Delete Search widget

  • Delete Meta widget

  • Delete all sidebar widgets

3- Theme Management & Activation

  • Upload a Theme File (zip)

  • Upload a Theme File (from URL)

  • Activate a Defined Theme

4- Plugin Management & Activation

  • Upload a Plugin File (zip)

  • Upload a Plugin File (from URL)

  • Activate a Defined Plugin

5- Add Custom Pages, plus predefined

  • About Us

  • Contact Us

  • Privacy Policy

  • Terms of Use

  • Earning Disclaimer

6- Set General Settings

  • Set Title

  • Set Description

  • Set permalinks

  • Set Notifications

  • Set Front Page Display

  • Set Post List
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the `/wp-content/plugins/WordpressInstaller directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
sections.faq:
What is the benefit of using WP Installer?

Nothing more that time
WP Istaller can setup your blog initially in 30 seconds instead of browsing each section to configure it for the first time, Its like “do it in 30 secs instead of 30 mins”

short_description: WP Installer helps new WP installations by configuring the initial setup through 5 simple steps without setting each section

upgrade_notice.Pro Version:
WP Installer Pro Version also allows to: Create Posts during initial launch / Create Categories / Export a Settings File / Import a Setting File.

( Settings File is a plain .txt file that can be imported in another installation to clone the original settings without going through each step)
